page.title: 15Warbleton Cricket Club
page.content: The club was probably founded about lOO years ago. Originally play took place on the village green. In l947 Mr Peter Dunn made available a field in Rookery Lane on which a permanent pitch was created and is now maintained in excellent condition. No rent is asked for this facility. A small pavilion is on the site comprising two changing rooms and a kitchen. The club has about 2O members of whom 4 are village residents. Other players come from Horam & Heathfield. Matches are usually played on Sundays. There are about 25 fixtures each season. In l985 just over half resulted in victory. At present subscriptions are Â£2.OO a year and a match fee of Â£l.OO is payable at each game played. An annual dinner & dance is held in the village hall at which the refreshment ladies are recognised.
